publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 15:49:59 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials were found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.160.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Camp Wo-Chi-Ca, also known as Workers Childrens Camp, was a summer camp for children located in New Jersey. Established in 1934, and politically associated with the Communist Party, the camp was distinct from other summer camps of the time in that it was co-educational and attracted an extremely diverse population.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Camp Wo-Chi-Ca Records; TAM 206; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists mostly of printed circulars from the 1940's such as the Daily Wo-Chi-Can and the Wo-Ki-Mag, some of which document visits of figures such as Paul Robeson and Woody Guthrie. Songbooks and Benefit Concert programs are also included.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection, which were created in 1937-1976, are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.
